title: 2 Easy Ways to Apply Blur Effects to Photos on Instagram

steps.title: Open Instagram.
steps.content: Open Instagram. It's an orange and pink app with a white camera icon, typically located on your home screen (iPhone/iPad) or in the app drawer (Android). If prompted, enter your Instagram username and password, then tap Log In .

steps.title: Tap +.
steps.content: Tap + . The Plus icon is at the bottom of the screen in the center. Tap this icon when you want to create a new post.

steps.title: Tap Story.
steps.content: Tap Story . It’s one of the options at the bottom of the screen. A story allows you to take a photo with your camera and search for blur effects to add to the photo. Posting a story gives you access to more filters and effects that aren’t all available for regular Instagram posts.

steps.title: Open the Browse Effects menu.
steps.content: Open the Browse Effects menu. To do so, swipe left on the round icons at the bottom of the screen until you reach the one that has an icon that resembles a magnifying glass at the end. Tap the round icon with the magnifying glass labeled Browse Effects .

steps.title: Tap the magnifying glass icon.
steps.content: Tap the magnifying glass icon. It’s at the top of the list of effects on the left side of the menu bar.

steps.title: Search blur.
steps.content: Search blur . The search bar is at the top of the page. This displays a list of blur effects. Alternatively, you can search “Blur background” to find an effect that blurs the background, creating a camera effect.

steps.title: Tap an effect.
steps.content: Tap an effect. This displays a preview of the effect in the camera view at the top of the page. Try out different effects until you find one that you like.

steps.title: Tap the back arrow.
steps.content: Tap the back arrow. This displays the camera view with the effect applied in full-screen mode.

steps.title: Tap the round icon at the bottom of the screen.
steps.content: Tap the round icon at the bottom of the screen. It will have the effect icon in the center. This will take a picture with the blur effect applied.

steps.title: Add text, music or stickers to the photo.
steps.content: Add text, music or stickers to the photo. Use the icons at the top of the screen to add to the photo. The options are as follows: Tap the “Aa” icon at the top of the screen to add text to your photo. Tap the icon that resembles a smiley face sticker to apply stickers to the photo. Tap the icon with two music notes to add music to your story.

steps.title: Tap Your Stories.
steps.content: Tap Your Stories . It’s at the bottom of the screen. This posts the photo as a story on Instagram. If you want to download the photo without posting it, tap the icon with three dots (•••) at the top of the screen. Then tap Save .

steps.title: Open Instagram.
steps.content: Open Instagram. It's an orange and pink app with a white camera icon, typically located on your home screen (iPhone/iPad) or in the app drawer (Android). If prompted, enter your Instagram username and password, then tap Log In .

steps.title: Tap +.
steps.content: Tap + . The Plus icon is at the bottom of the screen in the center. Tap this icon when you want to create a new post.

steps.title: Tap Post.
steps.content: Tap Post . This allows you to post a photo to your Instagram feed. Not all effects that are available for Stories are available for posts.

steps.title: Select an image and tap Next.
steps.content: Select an image and tap Next . Tap the photo you want to upload and then tap Next in the upper-right corner.

steps.title: Tap Edit.
steps.content: Tap Edit . It's at the bottom of the screen on the right side. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Scroll right and tap Tilt Shift.
steps.content: Scroll right and tap Tilt Shift . It's the next-to-last editing option at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Select a blur effect.
steps.content: Select a blur effect. Choose one of the two options and then edit as desired. Radial: This selection adds blurring at the corners of the screen, leaving a round area at the center that remains clear. Slide your finger across the photo to focus on the subject area. Pinch your fingers in or out to adjust the size of the blurring effect. Linear: This selection leaves a linear area of the photo clear while blurring everything else. Slide your finger across the photo to choose the subject area. Pinch your fingers in or out to adjust the size of the blurring effect. Tap and rotate your two fingers to rotate the linear area.

steps.title: Tap Done.
steps.content: Tap Done . It's at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Share your photo.
steps.content: Share your photo. Type a caption into the text box, if desired, then tap Share . Your blurred photo will now appear in your Instagram feed.
